meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) sensitive or aware again.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the therapy resensitizes her to loud noises.
meanings.sent2: The counselor's words resensitizes the student to the importance of mental health.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot twist resensitizes the audience to the suspenseful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events resensitizes the story, making it more engaging.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise resensitizes the colors of the landscape, revealing its beauty once more.

meanings.definition: Restore sensitivity or responsiveness to (a drug or treatment).
meanings.sent1: The new medication resensitizes the patient to the effects of the treatment.
meanings.sent2: Proper rest resensitizes the body to the benefits of exercise.
meanings.sent3: The fresh dose of medicine resensitizes the patient to the healing process.
meanings.sent4: The updated technology resensitizes the device, improving its performance.
meanings.sent5: The maintenance resensitizes the equipment, ensuring its efficiency.
